item.title: Report E-2024080136
item.description:
Report E-2024080136

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-10
  • City: GLENPOOL
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10 ounces of product released to a 10’ x 10’ area of the trailer floor, concrete dock, and bay due to a faulty leaking weld on the bottom of the tote. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The impacted area was cleaned with pads to reduce staining. The damaged empty tote and drums of product were staged onsite pending shipper’s disposition.

  • Description: Package was found at the front of belt 3 at NOKC 732 wet and leaking from a bottle of clorox germicidal bleach that had a loose cap. Package is an undeclared hazmat. Package was placed into a red tote with a hazmat bag.

item.title: Report E-2024080110
item.description:
Report E-2024080110

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-08T15:13:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-03
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2-gallons of CAT YELLOW PAINT released from (2) 5-gallon metal pails due to improper loading. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and terminal personnel felt comfortable cleaning the release with the PPE available on site.
